texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  Procurement  Manual  provides  operational  procedures  to  the  Procurement  practitioners.  It reinforces the Procurement Standards, the Procurement Charter, and the Procurement Delegation of Authority (PDoA), giving a more detailed explanation of their application.
texts.text: The  Procurement  Manual  provides  operational  procedures  to  the  Procurement  practitioners.  It reinforces the Procurement Standards, the Procurement Charter, and the Procurement Delegation of Authority (PDoA), giving a more detailed explanation of their application.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement Manual applies to all procurement activities conducted by the government Entities and  the  Government  Procurement  Office  (GPO).  The  Executive  Council  (EC),  or  a  relevant  body authorised by the EC, may exclude an Entity from the application of the Procurement Manual. The Procurement  Manual  covers  all  relevant  procurement  processes  and  serves  as  the  operational framework.
texts.text: The Procurement Manual applies to all procurement activities conducted by the government Entities and  the  Government  Procurement  Office  (GPO).  The  Executive  Council  (EC),  or  a  relevant  body authorised by the EC, may exclude an Entity from the application of the Procurement Manual. The Procurement  Manual  covers  all  relevant  procurement  processes  and  serves  as  the  operational framework.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Procurement consists  of  the  Government Procurement Office (GPO) and Entity Procurement .  The Procurement Operating Model provides mandate, empowerment, and responsibilities of the Government Procurement Office (GPO) and Entity Procurement .
texts.text: The Procurement consists  of  the  Government Procurement Office (GPO) and Entity Procurement .  The Procurement Operating Model provides mandate, empowerment, and responsibilities of the Government Procurement Office (GPO) and Entity Procurement .

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Government Procurement Office (GPO) is established to fulfil the following objectives:
texts.text: The Government Procurement Office (GPO) is established to fulfil the following objectives:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Acting on behalf of the Entities to consolidate demand for achieving economies of scale. The GPO is authorized to manage and execute sourcing for Common Categories.
texts.text: Acting on behalf of the Entities to consolidate demand for achieving economies of scale. The GPO is authorized to manage and execute sourcing for Common Categories.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Providing  shared  services  such  as  Supplier  Registration,  Item  Master  Management,  User  Master Management, and Training.
texts.text: Providing  shared  services  such  as  Supplier  Registration,  Item  Master  Management,  User  Master Management, and Training.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Maintaining the Procurement Framework ensuring a standardized and efficient way of working of the Procurement .
texts.text: Maintaining the Procurement Framework ensuring a standardized and efficient way of working of the Procurement .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) Developing and operating the information technology platform for government procurement (eGate).
texts.text: Developing and operating the information technology platform for government procurement (eGate).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) Running  market  development  initiatives  and  managing  partnerships  with  the  private  sector  in coordination with the relevant authorities.
texts.text: Running  market  development  initiatives  and  managing  partnerships  with  the  private  sector  in coordination with the relevant authorities.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Category  taxonomy  refers  to  a  hierarchical  assignment  of  goods/services.  In  line  with  global  best practices, UNSPSC (United Nations Standard Products and Services Code) taxonomy is recommended to be adopted by GPO and Entity Procurement .    UNSPSC is a four-level taxonomy with each record represented with an eight-digit number and unique name, illustrated below:
texts.text: Category  taxonomy  refers  to  a  hierarchical  assignment  of  goods/services.  In  line  with  global  best practices, UNSPSC (United Nations Standard Products and Services Code) taxonomy is recommended to be adopted by GPO and Entity Procurement .    UNSPSC is a four-level taxonomy with each record represented with an eight-digit number and unique name, illustrated below:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Entity Procurement is  responsible for procurement of the Entity-Specific Categories including sourcing, contracting, ordering, and managing Supplier performance. The Entity Procurement utilizes  the  shared services provided by the GPO.
texts.text: Entity Procurement is  responsible for procurement of the Entity-Specific Categories including sourcing, contracting, ordering, and managing Supplier performance. The Entity Procurement utilizes  the  shared services provided by the GPO.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  GPO  engages  stakeholders  from  the  Entities  and  dedicated Finance , Legal or  other  resources  as needed  for  procuring  Common  Categories.  The  Entity Procurement engages End-Users and  dedicated Finance , Legal or other resources for procuring Entity-Specific Categories.
texts.text: The  GPO  engages  stakeholders  from  the  Entities  and  dedicated Finance , Legal or  other  resources  as needed  for  procuring  Common  Categories.  The  Entity Procurement engages End-Users and  dedicated Finance , Legal or other resources for procuring Entity-Specific Categories.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Classification  of  a  category  as  a  Common  Category  or  an  Entity-Specific  Category  depends  on  the category spend value and its commonality across Entities. A category that is procured by five or more Entities may be considered as a Common Category.
texts.text: Classification  of  a  category  as  a  Common  Category  or  an  Entity-Specific  Category  depends  on  the category spend value and its commonality across Entities. A category that is procured by five or more Entities may be considered as a Common Category.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The four primary levels of the UNSPSC are Segment, Family, Class, and Commodity. Each level is identified by two digits, that constitute together an overall eight-digit code.
texts.text: The four primary levels of the UNSPSC are Segment, Family, Class, and Commodity. Each level is identified by two digits, that constitute together an overall eight-digit code.

texts.orig: The Procurement Capability Model comprises of four types of procurement capabilities: Strategic, Tactical, Operational, and Support as illustrated below:
texts.text: The Procurement Capability Model comprises of four types of procurement capabilities: Strategic, Tactical, Operational, and Support as illustrated below:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Procurement Strategy (Level 2) process group includes procedures to develop strategy for the Procurement function in line with the overall Entity strategy.
texts.text: Procurement Strategy (Level 2) process group includes procedures to develop strategy for the Procurement function in line with the overall Entity strategy.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Demand and  Category  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  develop 'Category Strategy' to deliver value and drive cost savings, and 'Procurement Plan' to bridge the demand-supply gap.
texts.text: Demand and  Category  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  develop 'Category Strategy' to deliver value and drive cost savings, and 'Procurement Plan' to bridge the demand-supply gap.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Source to Contract (Level 2) process group includes procedures to conduct sourcing and award Suppliers.
texts.text: Source to Contract (Level 2) process group includes procedures to conduct sourcing and award Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Contract  Lifecycle  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  create  and manage contracts.
texts.text: Contract  Lifecycle  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  create  and manage contracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Supplier  performance  and  Relationship  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  the procedures to segment Suppliers, manage relationships with selected Suppliers , and evaluate and manage performance of Suppliers.
texts.text: Supplier  performance  and  Relationship  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  the procedures to segment Suppliers, manage relationships with selected Suppliers , and evaluate and manage performance of Suppliers.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Requisition to Pay (Level 2) process group includes procedures to create Purchase Requisition (PR), create Purchase Order (PO), receive goods/services, create Goods/Services/Project Receipt, and reconcile invoice.
texts.text: Requisition to Pay (Level 2) process group includes procedures to create Purchase Requisition (PR), create Purchase Order (PO), receive goods/services, create Goods/Services/Project Receipt, and reconcile invoice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Risk  and  Regulation  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  conduct  risk  profiling  for Suppliers , identify and mitigate procurement risks, and implement regulatory changes.
texts.text: Risk  and  Regulation  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  conduct  risk  profiling  for Suppliers , identify and mitigate procurement risks, and implement regulatory changes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) Supplier  Master  Data  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  register, qualify, disqualify, deactivate, and reactivate Suppliers .
texts.text: Supplier  Master  Data  Management  (Level  2) process  group includes  procedures  to  register, qualify, disqualify, deactivate, and reactivate Suppliers .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) Item Master Data Management (Level 2) process group includes procedures to add, modify, and remove goods/services/projects from the master database.
texts.text: Item Master Data Management (Level 2) process group includes procedures to add, modify, and remove goods/services/projects from the master database.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: User Master Data Management (Level 2) process group includes procedures to add, modify, and delete users in User Master Data.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Baseline  Spend  is  the  foundation  of  the  Procurement  Benefits  calculation.  It  is  the  value  of addressable spend against which any benefit is measured. Establishing a baseline is the first step in the Procurement Benefits calculations process.
texts.text: Baseline  Spend  is  the  foundation  of  the  Procurement  Benefits  calculation.  It  is  the  value  of addressable spend against which any benefit is measured. Establishing a baseline is the first step in the Procurement Benefits calculations process.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Procurement Benefits can be classified into Cost Reduction, Cost Avoidance, and Cash Impact. Details of the same are provided below:
texts.text: Procurement Benefits can be classified into Cost Reduction, Cost Avoidance, and Cash Impact. Details of the same are provided below:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Following general principles apply to the calculation of Baseline Spend and Procurement Benefits:
texts.text: Following general principles apply to the calculation of Baseline Spend and Procurement Benefits:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. An agreed baseline is required for Procurement Benefits calculations and must be signed-off by the relevant stakeholders from the End-User , the Finance and the Procurement .
texts.text: An agreed baseline is required for Procurement Benefits calculations and must be signed-off by the relevant stakeholders from the End-User , the Finance and the Procurement .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Baseline could be historic actuals (e.g., prior year spend, budgeted spend, etc.).
texts.text: Baseline could be historic actuals (e.g., prior year spend, budgeted spend, etc.).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. The baseline must be supported by one or multiple data sets, such as  Accounts Payable (AP) data, Purchase Orders (PO) data, Contracts data, etc.
texts.text: The baseline must be supported by one or multiple data sets, such as  Accounts Payable (AP) data, Purchase Orders (PO) data, Contracts data, etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv. An appropriate method to calculate the Baseline Spend should be determined for each type of procurement benefit.
texts.text: An appropriate method to calculate the Baseline Spend should be determined for each type of procurement benefit.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Procurement Benefits can be calculated after acceptance of a final, binding offer from one or more Supplier(s) and the acknowledgment of offer conditions (with written confirmation, Letter of Intent, contract amendment, etc.).
texts.text: Procurement Benefits can be calculated after acceptance of a final, binding offer from one or more Supplier(s) and the acknowledgment of offer conditions (with written confirmation, Letter of Intent, contract amendment, etc.).

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Benefits implementation  costs (one-time investments) are excluded from  the benefits calculation.
texts.text: Benefits implementation  costs (one-time investments) are excluded from  the benefits calculation.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Baseline Spend is based on two parameters and is calculated as following:
texts.text: Baseline Spend is based on two parameters and is calculated as following:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Baseline Spend = Total Volume * Baseline Unit Price
texts.text: Baseline Spend = Total Volume * Baseline Unit Price

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Total volume may be known or unknown. However, two methods can be used for calculations to estimate volume, as detailed:
texts.text: Total volume may be known or unknown. However, two methods can be used for calculations to estimate volume, as detailed:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Historic price baseline is relevant when the goods/services/projects were purchased previously (in last year). Below are the details of various methods to create a historic price baseline:
texts.text: Historic price baseline is relevant when the goods/services/projects were purchased previously (in last year). Below are the details of various methods to create a historic price baseline:

texts.label: caption
texts.orig: Table 1.4.3 Historic Baseline Price Calculation Methodologies
texts.text: Table 1.4.3 Historic Baseline Price Calculation Methodologies

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If a certain goods/service has not been purchased previously, historic price baseline cannot be established. In such cases, the baseline price can be estimated using comparable goods/services/projects  (identical  or  similar  specifications)  where  the  price  is  known.  (e.g., estimating  the  baseline  price  for  a  car  rental  service  by  comparing  it  with  similar  services previously purchased by another Entity).
texts.text: If a certain goods/service has not been purchased previously, historic price baseline cannot be established. In such cases, the baseline price can be estimated using comparable goods/services/projects  (identical  or  similar  specifications)  where  the  price  is  known.  (e.g., estimating  the  baseline  price  for  a  car  rental  service  by  comparing  it  with  similar  services previously purchased by another Entity).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: If  neither  a  historic  nor  a  comparable  baseline  can  be  established,  a  new  baseline  can  be developed based on the initial RFI or RFP/RFQ responses provided by the Suppliers . The baseline price  will  be  calculated  as  an  average  of  the  approved  initial  quotes.  Any  price  reductions received through follow-on RFP/ auction/negotiation is considered as benefits.
texts.text: If  neither  a  historic  nor  a  comparable  baseline  can  be  established,  a  new  baseline  can  be developed based on the initial RFI or RFP/RFQ responses provided by the Suppliers . The baseline price  will  be  calculated  as  an  average  of  the  approved  initial  quotes.  Any  price  reductions received through follow-on RFP/ auction/negotiation is considered as benefits.

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: a. Standard Method (last paid price -new price)
texts.text: a. Standard Method (last paid price -new price)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This  method  is  used  when  the  savings  result  from  the  difference  between  baseline  and negotiated price. For example, when Suppliers are changed or when similar goods/services/projects  are  bundled,  resulting  in  a  better  price  per  item.  Savings  in  this scenario are calculated as follows:
texts.text: This  method  is  used  when  the  savings  result  from  the  difference  between  baseline  and negotiated price. For example, when Suppliers are changed or when similar goods/services/projects  are  bundled,  resulting  in  a  better  price  per  item.  Savings  in  this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: These are the savings realized when contracts negotiated with Suppliers include 'extras' that have not been part of the goods/service offering of past purchases. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:
texts.text: These are the savings realized when contracts negotiated with Suppliers include 'extras' that have not been part of the goods/service offering of past purchases. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = Savings from free of charge 'extra' per unit * volume
texts.text: Savings = Savings from free of charge 'extra' per unit * volume

texts.label: section_header
texts.orig: c. Fluctuating market price with market Index
texts.text: c. Fluctuating market price with market Index

texts.label: text
texts.orig: This method of calculation is used when the cost savings can be attributed to a changing market index that results in a better future price (with respect to the market price). This method  is  applicable  for  commodities  (crude  oil,  metals,  Agri-commodities,  etc.)  where prices are linked to indices and change frequently. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:
texts.text: This method of calculation is used when the cost savings can be attributed to a changing market index that results in a better future price (with respect to the market price). This method  is  applicable  for  commodities  (crude  oil,  metals,  Agri-commodities,  etc.)  where prices are linked to indices and change frequently. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = Forecasted spend with historical index value -forecasted spend with new index value
texts.text: Savings = Forecasted spend with historical index value -forecasted spend with new index value

texts.text: This method of calculation is used when the Supplier offers rebates on volume or similar incentives, which have not been included in previous purchases. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = (new rebate per unit -old rebate per unit) * volume
texts.text: Savings = (new rebate per unit -old rebate per unit) * volume

New specifications  examples  may  include  (but  not  limited  to)  using  black  and  white  printers instead of coloured printers, using standard cars instead of high-end cars for rentals, and using  standard  event  designs  instead  of  specialized  events. texts.text: For some goods/services/projects, the specification can be changed to reduce the price. New specifications  examples  may  include  (but  not  limited  to)  using  black  and  white  printers instead of coloured printers, using standard cars instead of high-end cars for rentals, and using  standard  event  designs  instead  of  specialized  events.  Savings  in  this  scenario  are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = (Cost for original item/service -cost for substitute item/service) * volume
texts.text: Savings = (Cost for original item/service -cost for substitute item/service) * volume

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For some categories, where services are provided in-house, outsourcing of services might be a viable option. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:
texts.text: For some categories, where services are provided in-house, outsourcing of services might be a viable option. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = (In-house cost (i.e. labor cost + material cost + overhead cost) -purchase price) x volume
texts.text: Savings = (In-house cost (i.e. labor cost + material cost + overhead cost) -purchase price) x volume

texts.label: text
texts.orig: For some categories lease of goods might be a viable alternative to buying (or vice versa). To compare the savings between leasing and buying options for goods, the cost per one unit needs to be calculated and compared. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:
texts.text: For some categories lease of goods might be a viable alternative to buying (or vice versa). To compare the savings between leasing and buying options for goods, the cost per one unit needs to be calculated and compared. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = (Cost of purchasing per unit - leasing cost per unit) * volume
texts.text: Savings = (Cost of purchasing per unit - leasing cost per unit) * volume

texts.label: text

texts.text: At the end of their lifetime, some goods (e.g., Laptop) may be recycled. These costs need to be considered to determine the actual price of a product. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: Savings = Historic cost for disposal -new cost for disposal
texts.text: Savings = Historic cost for disposal -new cost for disposal

texts.text: This  method  is  used  when  the  involvement  of Procurement leads  to  a  reduction  of inventories (e.g., stock) and results in significant cost savings. Savings in this scenario are calculated as follows:

texts.label: text

texts.label: text

texts.text: Savings = Working Capital Improvement = Average monthly invoice from supplier (VAT included) * New Payment terms (in days) / 30 * WACC

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Abu Dhabi Local Content Program aims to direct government spending towards the development of the local economy in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. The tenders published by government entities must ask for the submission of the ICV Certificate, sponsored by the Department of Economic Development of Abu Dhabi.
texts.text: The Abu Dhabi Local Content Program aims to direct government spending towards the development of the local economy in the Emirate of Abu Dhabi. The tenders published by government entities must ask for the submission of the ICV Certificate, sponsored by the Department of Economic Development of Abu Dhabi.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The  weight  given  to  the  local  content  must  constitute  40%  of  the  overall  score  allocated  to  the financial/commercial  evaluation  score.  The  program  will  encourage  suppliers  to  participate  in government  tenders  to  increase  their  economic  contribution  in  Abu  Dhabi  through  Emiratization, Investments, and Locally procured goods and services. For further information regarding the Abu Dhabi Local Content program, please visit https://idb.added.gov.ae/

texts.orig: 1.5.2 Economic Incentives for MSMEs (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises)
texts.text: 1.5.2 Economic Incentives for MSMEs (Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises)

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Abu Dhabi Department of Economic Development (AD-DED) recognizes the following types of businesses as MSMEs:
texts.text: The Abu Dhabi Department of Economic Development (AD-DED) recognizes the following types of businesses as MSMEs:

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Department of Government Support (DGS) has announced the following economic incentives in government Procurement for MSMEs:
texts.text: The Department of Government Support (DGS) has announced the following economic incentives in government Procurement for MSMEs:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) All Entities/GPO shall allocate 15% of their annual purchases and contracts to MSMEs.
texts.text: All Entities/GPO shall allocate 15% of their annual purchases and contracts to MSMEs.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) All MSMEs shall be exempted from submitting the Bid Bond bank guarantee.
texts.text: All MSMEs shall be exempted from submitting the Bid Bond bank guarantee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) All MSMEs shall be exempted from submitting the Performance Bond bank guarantee, provided that the Entities reserves 5% of the value of each invoice due for a period of 3 months after the final delivery.
texts.text: All MSMEs shall be exempted from submitting the Performance Bond bank guarantee, provided that the Entities reserves 5% of the value of each invoice due for a period of 3 months after the final delivery.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) All dues shall be paid to the MSMEs within a period of 15 days from the date of the invoice.
texts.text: All dues shall be paid to the MSMEs within a period of 15 days from the date of the invoice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e) The  Entity  must  submit  quarterly  reports  to  the  GPO  on  the  implementation  of  the  above guidelines.
texts.text: The  Entity  must  submit  quarterly  reports  to  the  GPO  on  the  implementation  of  the  above guidelines.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The organizations having Abu Dhabi DED commercial licenses and owned in 100% by UAE nationals (including  partners)  are  recognized  as  Emirati  Entrepreneurs  by  the  Abu  Dhabi  Department  of Economic Development (AD-DED).
texts.text: The organizations having Abu Dhabi DED commercial licenses and owned in 100% by UAE nationals (including  partners)  are  recognized  as  Emirati  Entrepreneurs  by  the  Abu  Dhabi  Department  of Economic Development (AD-DED).

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The Department of Government Support (DGS) has announced the following economic incentives in government Procurement for Emirati Entrepreneurs:
texts.text: The Department of Government Support (DGS) has announced the following economic incentives in government Procurement for Emirati Entrepreneurs:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) All Emirati Entrepreneurs shall be exempted from submitting the Bid Bond bank guarantee.
texts.text: All Emirati Entrepreneurs shall be exempted from submitting the Bid Bond bank guarantee.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) All  Emirati  Entrepreneurs  shall  be  exempted  from  submitting  the  Performance  Bond  bank guarantee, provided that the Entity reserves 5% of the value of each invoice due for a period of 3 months after the final delivery.
texts.text: All  Emirati  Entrepreneurs  shall  be  exempted  from  submitting  the  Performance  Bond  bank guarantee, provided that the Entity reserves 5% of the value of each invoice due for a period of 3 months after the final delivery.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) All dues shall be paid to the Emirati Entrepreneurs within a period of 15 days from the date of the invoice.
texts.text: All dues shall be paid to the Emirati Entrepreneurs within a period of 15 days from the date of the invoice.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d) The  Entities  must  submit  quarterly  reports  to  the  GPO  on  the  implementation  of  the  above guidelines.
texts.text: The  Entities  must  submit  quarterly  reports  to  the  GPO  on  the  implementation  of  the  above guidelines.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: 'Procurement  Strategy' is  a  highlevel  document  that  states  an  Entity's  approach  to  achieving  its procurement objectives, executing its activities and key initiatives. It guides on allocation of resources and budget for strategic initiatives and aligns procurement activities with Entity strategy and Abu Dhabi Governmental initiatives.
texts.text: 'Procurement  Strategy' is  a  highlevel  document  that  states  an  Entity's  approach  to  achieving  its procurement objectives, executing its activities and key initiatives. It guides on allocation of resources and budget for strategic initiatives and aligns procurement activities with Entity strategy and Abu Dhabi Governmental initiatives.

texts.label: text
texts.orig: The 'Procurement Strategy'  is created  with  mid-to-long  term  perspective  and  updated  yearly.  Key elements of value proposition addressed by the 'Procurement Strategy' include (but not limited to):

texts.text: Conduct  Spend  analysis  In  addition  to  above, spend  data  is  collated  and  analysed  for additional optimization opportunities. This analysis provides insights into historical spend, Supplier base, and spend categories to identify the focus areas for improvement.

texts.orig: c. Conduct Market analysis Assigned key members analyse the evolution of markets, trends and  conditions  to  assess  their  impact  on  the Procurement .  The  necessary  data  may  be collected  through  primary  and  secondary  sources.  This  data  is  updated  over  time,  to maintain  relevance.  Various  methodologies,  such  as Por ter's  five  forces (industry  rivalry, buyer  power,  Supplier  power,  threat  to  new  entrant,  substitution  possibilities),  TOWS (Threat, Opportunities, Weakness, and Strengths) and PESTLE (political, economic, social, technological, legal and environmental) analysis may be used.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a) Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group consists of procedures to segment Suppliers , manage relationships with selected Suppliers , and manage performance of Suppliers against open contracts.
texts.text: Supplier Performance and Relationship Management (SPRM) process group consists of procedures to segment Suppliers , manage relationships with selected Suppliers , and manage performance of Suppliers against open contracts.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b) This  section  explains  the  activities,  decisions  involved,  documents  used,  outcomes,  and  the stakeholders involved in the SPRM processes.
texts.text: This  section  explains  the  activities,  decisions  involved,  documents  used,  outcomes,  and  the stakeholders involved in the SPRM processes.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c) The following Level 3 processes are included in the SPRM process group:
texts.text: The following Level 3 processes are included in the SPRM process group:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. The purpose of this process is to classify Suppliers into following pre-defined segments:
texts.text: The purpose of this process is to classify Suppliers into following pre-defined segments:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Strategic Suppliers -show potential of innovation and collaboration, have a proven track record, and are some of the highest spend Suppliers .
texts.text: Strategic Suppliers -show potential of innovation and collaboration, have a proven track record, and are some of the highest spend Suppliers .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Critical Suppliers -are critical to everyday operations and any failure by such Suppliers has a significant impact on the Entity 's operations.
texts.text: Critical Suppliers -are critical to everyday operations and any failure by such Suppliers has a significant impact on the Entity 's operations.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. Operational Suppliers -have contracted commitments that require operational tracking and delivery monitoring .
texts.text: Operational Suppliers -have contracted commitments that require operational tracking and delivery monitoring .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. Transactional Suppliers -have minimal contracted spend with the least impact.
texts.text: Transactional Suppliers -have minimal contracted spend with the least impact.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Common Category Suppliers are considered as Strategic Suppliers .
texts.text: Common Category Suppliers are considered as Strategic Suppliers .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. Segment Suppliers process is executed periodically, preferably once a year.
texts.text: Segment Suppliers process is executed periodically, preferably once a year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv. While segmenting Suppliers, it is crucial to consider the contracted spend with each Supplier for the same period to maintain a fair comparison. Only Suppliers with contracted spend during the period of review may be considered for this process.
texts.text: While segmenting Suppliers, it is crucial to consider the contracted spend with each Supplier for the same period to maintain a fair comparison. Only Suppliers with contracted spend during the period of review may be considered for this process.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: v. An SRM Specialist is assigned to segment Suppliers . To segment Suppliers catering to Common Categories, SRM Specialist is assigned from the GPO and to segment Suppliers catering to EntitySpecific Categories, SRM Specialist is assigned from the Entity managing the category.
texts.text: An SRM Specialist is assigned to segment Suppliers . To segment Suppliers catering to Common Categories, SRM Specialist is assigned from the GPO and to segment Suppliers catering to EntitySpecific Categories, SRM Specialist is assigned from the Entity managing the category.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The  provided 'Supplier  Segmentation Input  Collection  Form ' template  is  designed  to segment Supplier s, based on following two parameters:
texts.text: The  provided 'Supplier  Segmentation Input  Collection  Form ' template  is  designed  to segment Supplier s, based on following two parameters:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a1. Business Impact of the Supplier - implies how vital the Supplier is to business operations and future initiatives.
texts.text: a1. Business Impact of the Supplier - implies how vital the Supplier is to business operations and future initiatives.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a2. Supplier  Risk  /Complexity  implies  the  dependence  on  the Supplier and  ease  of switching the Supplier , if required.
texts.text: a2. Supplier  Risk  /Complexity  implies  the  dependence  on  the Supplier and  ease  of switching the Supplier , if required.

texts.text: The assigned SRM Specialist shares the 'Supplier Segmentation Input Collection Form ' with Category Managers to collate required scores for Suppliers specific to their category.

texts.orig: c. In  case  of  categories  without  assigned Category Managers, 'Supplier Segmentation Input Collection Form ' is shared with Contract Administrators or End-Users .
texts.text: In  case  of  categories  without  assigned Category Managers, 'Supplier Segmentation Input Collection Form ' is shared with Contract Administrators or End-Users .

texts.text: The assigned SRM Specialist collates various 'Supplier Segmentation Input Collection Form ' received into the 'Supplier Segmentation Report' template provided .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. Supplier performance is evaluated and managed against each open contract, separately. Each evaluation leads to a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard', which summarizes performance against the KPIs of the contract.
texts.text: Supplier performance is evaluated and managed against each open contract, separately. Each evaluation leads to a 'Supplier Performance Scorecard', which summarizes performance against the KPIs of the contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. The Contracting  Specialist/Lead, assigned  to  execute  the  CLM  processes,  is  responsible  for evaluating and managing Supplier performance against the respective contract.
texts.text: The Contracting  Specialist/Lead, assigned  to  execute  the  CLM  processes,  is  responsible  for evaluating and managing Supplier performance against the respective contract.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead identifies the frequency of Supplier performance evaluation and customizes the 'Supplier Performance Input Collection Form'.
texts.text: The assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead identifies the frequency of Supplier performance evaluation and customizes the 'Supplier Performance Input Collection Form'.

texts.text: Details of Supplier performance evaluation criteria and frequency are communicated to the Supplier.

texts.text: For each performance evaluation cycle, the assigned Contracting Specialist/Lead shares the 'Supplier  Performance  Evaluation  Form'  with  relevant Contract  Administrators and EndUsers .

texts.text: The  assigned Contracting  Specialist/Lead collates  various 'Supplier  Performance  Input Collection Form' and fills the provided 'Supplier Performance Scorecard' template .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. The purpose of this process is to confirm acceptance of the goods/services/projects and create a receipt for the accepted delivery.
texts.text: The purpose of this process is to confirm acceptance of the goods/services/projects and create a receipt for the accepted delivery.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. The process includes quality inspection and management of return of goods to the Suppliers .
texts.text: The process includes quality inspection and management of return of goods to the Suppliers .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: i. Receive goods/services/projects and match against PO
texts.text: Receive goods/services/projects and match against PO

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. The goods received by the End-User or the store/warehouse are reviewed to ensure that the quantity delivered and specifications match with the PO and the delivery documents.
texts.text: The goods received by the End-User or the store/warehouse are reviewed to ensure that the quantity delivered and specifications match with the PO and the delivery documents.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Based on the review, one of the following approaches may be taken:
texts.text: Based on the review, one of the following approaches may be taken:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I. Delivery of goods is accepted by the End-User or store/warehouse if the quantity and  specification  match  with  that  provided  in  the  PO  or  are  within  acceptable tolerances specified in the PO.
texts.text: Delivery of goods is accepted by the End-User or store/warehouse if the quantity and  specification  match  with  that  provided  in  the  PO  or  are  within  acceptable tolerances specified in the PO.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: II. Delivery of goods can be rejected completely or partially (e.g., % of goods delivered are not as per the specification in the PO). In case of partial or complete rejection, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier.
texts.text: Delivery of goods can be rejected completely or partially (e.g., % of goods delivered are not as per the specification in the PO). In case of partial or complete rejection, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: III. Depending on the reason for rejection, the Supplier either replaces the defective/damaged goods or delivers the missing goods.
texts.text: Depending on the reason for rejection, the Supplier either replaces the defective/damaged goods or delivers the missing goods.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: I. Delivery of services/projects is accepted by the End-User if the specification match with that provided in the PO or are within acceptable tolerances specified in the PO. The End-User provides  inputs  on  delivery  with  respect  to milestones,  KPI's/SLA, timelines etc.
texts.text: Delivery of services/projects is accepted by the End-User if the specification match with that provided in the PO or are within acceptable tolerances specified in the PO. The End-User provides  inputs  on  delivery  with  respect  to milestones,  KPI's/SLA, timelines etc.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: II. Delivery of services/projects can be rejected completely or partially. In case of partial or complete rejection, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier.
texts.text: Delivery of services/projects can be rejected completely or partially. In case of partial or complete rejection, the discrepancy is communicated to the Procurement and the Supplier.

texts.text: This process also enables Petty Cash/P-Card purchases below certain spend thresholds specified in  the  PDoA .  Petty  Cash/P-Card  purchases  can  be  fulfilled  without  the  involvement  of  the Procurement .

texts.text: For purchases below the spend threshold specified for P-Card or Petty Cash purchases in the PDoA, the End-user directly engages with the Supplier and procures required goods/services/projects.

texts.text: The following Level 3 processes are included in the R&R process group:

texts.text: The purpose of this process is to identify high risk Suppliers and optimize the risk mitigation efforts.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: Conduct Supplier Risk Profiling process is conducted periodically, preferably once a year.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iii. An SRM Specialist is assigned to conduct risk profiling for Suppliers . To conduct risk profiling of Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories, the SRM Specialist is assigned from the Entity. . To  conduct  risk  profiling  of Suppliers catering  to  Common  Categories,  the SRM Specialist is assigned from the GPO.
texts.text: An SRM Specialist is assigned to conduct risk profiling for Suppliers . To conduct risk profiling of Suppliers catering to Entity-Specific Categories, the SRM Specialist is assigned from the Entity. . To  conduct  risk  profiling  of Suppliers catering  to  Common  Categories,  the SRM Specialist is assigned from the GPO.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: iv. As per the Supplier Segment Strategy (please refer to Figure 2.5.2 ), the risk profiling is conducted for following Suppliers :
texts.text: As per the Supplier Segment Strategy (please refer to Figure 2.5.2 ), the risk profiling is conducted for following Suppliers :

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Operational Suppliers with spend in the top 80% of the Entity spend.
texts.text: Operational Suppliers with spend in the top 80% of the Entity spend.

texts.label: list_item

texts.text: 'Supplier Risk Profiling Input Collection Form' template is designed to assess following types of Supplier risks:

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Suppliers are evaluated on above mentioned risk types on a four-point scale (0 -No risk, 1 -Low Risk, 2- Medium risk, 3 -High risk, and 4 -Significant risk). Suppliers with a score of 3 (or above) on any of the risk types are considered as high-risk Suppliers .
texts.text: Suppliers are evaluated on above mentioned risk types on a four-point scale (0 -No risk, 1 -Low Risk, 2- Medium risk, 3 -High risk, and 4 -Significant risk). Suppliers with a score of 3 (or above) on any of the risk types are considered as high-risk Suppliers .

texts.label: list_item

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: ii. A Supplier can be considered as a 'Preferred' Supplier only after, at least, one year of continual business. During this year, the Supplier performance is monitored to decide if the Supplier should be considered as a 'Preferred' Supplier for the category.
texts.text: A Supplier can be considered as a 'Preferred' Supplier only after, at least, one year of continual business. During this year, the Supplier performance is monitored to decide if the Supplier should be considered as a 'Preferred' Supplier for the category.

texts.orig: i. The purpose of this process is to deactivate Suppliers with an expired commercial/industrial license and reactivate them once the commercial/industrial License is renewed.
texts.text: The purpose of this process is to deactivate Suppliers with an expired commercial/industrial license and reactivate them once the commercial/industrial License is renewed.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. 'Deactivated' status implies that the 'SAP Ariba' profile of the Supplier is no longer active. Suppliers  in  'Deactivated'  status  are  not  visible  in  any  search  list,  cannot  participate  in tenders, and cannot be awarded.
texts.text: 'Deactivated' status implies that the 'SAP Ariba' profile of the Supplier is no longer active. Suppliers  in  'Deactivated'  status  are  not  visible  in  any  search  list,  cannot  participate  in tenders, and cannot be awarded.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. All existing contracts with the Supplier must be terminated before deactivating a Supplier .
texts.text: All existing contracts with the Supplier must be terminated before deactivating a Supplier .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: c. A Supplier Data Management Specialist is  assigned  to  conduct  quarterly  reviews  of  the Supplier Master Database and identify Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license .
texts.text: A Supplier Data Management Specialist is  assigned  to  conduct  quarterly  reviews  of  the Supplier Master Database and identify Suppliers with expired commercial/industrial license .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: d. The Suppliers with  expired  commercial/industrial  license  receive  an  email  requesting  to renew the license. The email mentions that if the renewed license is not reflected in 'SAP Ariba' before the next quarterly review, the Supplier may be 'Deactivated'.
texts.text: The Suppliers with  expired  commercial/industrial  license  receive  an  email  requesting  to renew the license. The email mentions that if the renewed license is not reflected in 'SAP Ariba' before the next quarterly review, the Supplier may be 'Deactivated'.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: e. In  case  the  assigned Supplier  Data  Management Specialist identifies  a Supplier with  an expired  commercial/industrial  license  in  the  next  quarterly  review  as  well  (even  after reminder),  the 'Supplier  Manager' may  'Deactivate'  t he Supplier and  provide  a  valid justification for the same.
texts.text: In  case  the  assigned Supplier  Data  Management Specialist identifies  a Supplier with  an expired  commercial/industrial  license  in  the  next  quarterly  review  as  well  (even  after reminder),  the 'Supplier  Manager' may  'Deactivate'  t he Supplier and  provide  a  valid justification for the same.

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: a. Supplier  must  update  the  'Registration  Questionnaire'  with  the  renewed  Commercial/ industrial license information to continue business. This is done through the Update Supplier Registration process explained in S ection 2.8.2.(III) .
texts.text: Supplier  must  update  the  'Registration  Questionnaire'  with  the  renewed  Commercial/ industrial license information to continue business. This is done through the Update Supplier Registration process explained in S ection 2.8.2.(III) .

texts.label: list_item
texts.orig: b. Upon review of the renewed commercial/industrial license, the 'Supplier Manager' may 'Reactivate' the Supplier. A reactivated Supplier resumes the same status as it had before deactivation.
texts.text: Upon review of the renewed commercial/industrial license, the 'Supplier Manager' may 'Reactivate' the Supplier. A reactivated Supplier resumes the same status as it had before deactivation.

4. Review and approve request to open the 'General Registration Questionnaire'. 5. Review the renewed commercial/industrial license. 6. Mark the supplier 'Reactivated' and provide justification.

table_cells.text: A system role assigned for validating the information provided in the 'Payment and Bank Questionnaire'.
Addressable spend against which any benefit is measured.
A bank guarantee submitted with bids to assure serious participation in the tender.
A business role accountable for spending decisions of the section/department.
A database of goods/services/projects readily available for raising a PR.
Category procured by five or more Entities.
The requesters or requesting parties of goods, services and projects.
Local departments and every juridical person reporting to the Government and having full legal capacity to act and manage a public facility or aiming to provide a public service.
Category procured by less than five Entities
The function within the government entity dedicated to financial affairs.
A document issued to acknowledge the receipt of goods/services/projects.
Individual assigned to lead the procurement unit.
The function within the government entity dedicated to legal affairs.
A tendering method that is open to predefined number of registered Suppliers.
Corporate card issued to authorized employees for making electronic payments for goods/service/projects.
A bank guarantee provided by the supplier or contractor to secure good performance and compliance with of the contract terms and conditions.
Small amounts of discretionary funds in the form of cash (defined in the PDoA) used for expenditures.
The procurement function existing within or outside the government entity.
Benefits that result in Cost Reduction, Cost Avoidance, and Cash Impact for procurement.
A formal document defining the roles and committees required for the procurement operations.
A formal document defining division of authority and powers in the government entity related to procurement operations.

table_cells.text: A set of interrelated documents devised to help procurement professionals in their work.
An integrated set of principles that harmonize the way of working, establish a unified operating model and define the performance of the Procurement.
A tendering method that is open to all Suppliers, and where the bids are invited through public announcements.

A legally binding document issued by the government entity to Suppliers in reference to the Contract or the Price List Agreement or on a standalone basis, indicating key parameters of purchase such as quantities, agreed prices, delivery schedule, payment terms and other relevant information and committing both parties upon explicit or implicit confirmation by Supplier.
A request generated by an End-User for securing goods/services/projects.
Sourcing Event used for screening Suppliers and gathering information or budget estimates from a broad base of potential Suppliers.
Sourcing Event used for seeking technical and commercial proposals from Suppliers.
Sourcing Event used for seeking pricing information for a defined scope of work or supply of specified goods or services.
Any government employee raising a request for goods/services/projects or other services provided by the GPO.

Sourcing Event used for seeking competitive bids in real time for highly commoditized goods, services and projects where specifications have already been fully acknowledged by participating Suppliers.
A document issued to acknowledge the completion of a service.
A tendering method that is open to only one qualified Supplier capable of supplying the required goods, services and projects or a single Supplier is selected from a pool of qualified Suppliers.
A request to find the supply source for the required goods/services/projects.
An individual or an organization engaged to supply the goods/services/projects.
A system role assigned for registering and qualifying Suppliers.
A committee established to evaluate the results of relevant tenders and encourage cross-functional collaboration.
